timeSeries.long_name: unique identifier for each feature instance

WPFM.long_name: sea surface wave spectral mean period

WPPE.comment: Period of the peak of the energy spectrum

SSWMD.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean direction
SSWMD.comment: Direction (related to the magnetic north) from which the mean period waves are coming from

WPDI.comment: Direction (related to the magnetic north) from which the peak period waves are coming from

WMDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean directional spread

WPDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave peak directional spread

WSSH.long_name: sea surface wave spectral significant height

WAVE_quality_control.long_name: primary Quality Control flag for wave variables
WAVE_quality_control.quality_control_convention: Ocean Data Standards, UNESCO 2013 - IOC Manuals and Guides, 54, Volume 3 Version 1

abstract: Near real-time in-situ wave data from shallow coastal waters (<35 m depth) along the NSW coast collected by temporary wave buoys deployed on moorings.
acknowledgement: Any users of data are required to clearly acknowledge the source of the material in the format: \"NSW nearshore wave buoy data were collected, processed and provided by the NSW Department of Planning and Environment Nearshore Wave Data Program\". For more information visit: https://datasets.seed.nsw.gov.au/dataset/nsw-nearshore-wave-buoy-parameter-time-series-data-completed-deployments. This dataset is an output from the Catching Oz Waves project, which received investment (https://doi.org/10.47486/DP748) from the Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC). The ARDC is funded by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS). Data was sourced from Australia\’s Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) - IMOS is enabled by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS).\
citation: The citation to be used in publications using the dataset should follow the format: “Kinsela, M.A., Morris, B.D., Ingleton, T.C., et al. (2022) Nearshore wave buoy data for coastal research and management in southeast Australia. Scientific Data. Australian Ocean Data Network (AODN). [year-of-datadownload], [Title], [Data access URL], accessed [dateof-access].
author: AODN
